title: Brigand
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A Brigand is a shady character who is especially good at killing, using daggers or darts. They start with a dagger, a robe and cloak, poisoned darts, and a few deadly and rare curare darts. |

**Brigands** are operatives who specialize in stealth and the killing of unsuspecting victims. They start with the tools to silently and quickly take down the living.

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Species](#Preferred_Species)
- [2 Racial restrictions](#Racial_restrictions)
- [3 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [4 Starting Skills and Stats](#Starting_Skills_and_Stats)
- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [6 History](#History)

## Preferred Species

[Troll](/Troll "Troll"), [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn"), [Spriggan](/Spriggan "Spriggan"), [Vine Stalker](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker"), and [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") are the recommended races if you pick a Brigand background.

## Racial restrictions

[Felids](/Felid "Felid") are forbidden from becoming Brigands because they cannot throw darts. A Felid Brigand would start with the same items as a [Monk](/Monk "Monk").

## Starting Equipment

Some [species](/Species "Species") may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

- +2 [dagger](/Dagger "Dagger")
- +0 [robe](/Robe "Robe")
- +0 [cloak](/Cloak "Cloak")
- 9 [poisoned](/Poison "Poison") [darts](/Dart "Dart")
- 3 [curare](/Curare "Curare") darts

## Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"): 2
- [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades"): 2
- [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing"): 2
- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 1
- [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth"): 4

Choosing Brigand adds 3 to your starting [Strength](/Strength "Strength"), 3 to your starting [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") and 6 to your starting [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").

## Strategy

Brigands are a good general starting background for stealthy types; the enchanted dagger handles early-game monsters fairly well, while the curare and poisoned darts are excellent for taking down tougher targets.

Don't underestimate the power of [curare](/Curare "Curare"). Curare deals a fair amount of damage on impact, then poisons and [slows](/Slow "Slow") the enemy. Almost all early-game threats up to [Lair](/Lair "Lair") will be greatly weakened by these darts. Of course, this assumes that you *hit* the dart. A few points into [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") skill will increase your accuracy.

Since you start with 3 curare darts, and there's a 1 in 6 chance that they [mulch](/Mulch "Mulch") (break) after fired, you'll have 18 shots on average. You can [kite](/Kite "Kite") enemies in order to conserve them. Throw the curare dart, then back away and throw regular poisoned darts afterward, slowly whittling their HP down.

## History

- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), most backgrounds were buffed; Brigands gained an extra poison and curare [dart](/Dart "Dart").
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), Brigands were called **Assassins**.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), Assassins began with a [blowgun](/Blowgun "Blowgun") and their respective [needles](/Needle "Needle") of poison and curare.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), the starting dagger had an enchantment of +2, +2.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), Assassins began with [potions of poison](/Potions_of_poison "Potions of poison") identified, and had 50 [gold](/Gold "Gold").

| [Backgrounds](/Background "Background") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| --------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Warriors                                | [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter") • [Gladiator](/Gladiator "Gladiator") • [Monk](/Monk "Monk") • [Hunter](/Hunter "Hunter") • [Brigand]()                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Zealots                                 | [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker") • [Chaos Knight](/Chaos_Knight "Chaos Knight") • [Cinder Acolyte](/Cinder_Acolyte "Cinder Acolyte")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Warrior-mages                           | [Warper](/Warper "Warper") • [Hexslinger](/Hexslinger "Hexslinger") • [Enchanter](/Enchanter "Enchanter") • [Reaver](/Reaver "Reaver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| Mages                                   | [Hedge Wizard](/Hedge_Wizard "Hedge Wizard") • [Conjurer](/Conjurer "Conjurer") • [Summoner](/Summoner "Summoner") • [Necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer") • [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist") • [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist") • [Air Elementalist](/Air_Elementalist "Air Elementalist") • [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist") • [Alchemist](/Alchemist "Alchemist") |
| Adventurers                             | [Artificer](/Artificer "Artificer") • [Shapeshifter](/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter") • [Wanderer](/Wanderer "Wanderer") • [Delver](/Delver "Delver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
html:
Brigand

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
A Brigand is a shady character who is especially good at killing, using daggers or darts. They start with a dagger, a robe and cloak, poisoned darts, and a few deadly and rare curare darts.

Brigands are operatives who specialize in stealth and the killing of unsuspecting victims. They start with the tools to silently and quickly take down the living.

Contents

  • 1 Preferred Species
  • 2 Racial restrictions
  • 3 Starting Equipment
  • 4 Starting Skills and Stats
  • 5 Strategy
  • 6 History

Preferred Species

Troll, Demonspawn, Spriggan, Vine Stalker, and Vampire are the recommended races if you pick a Brigand background.

Racial restrictions

Felids are forbidden from becoming Brigands because they cannot throw darts. A Felid Brigand would start with the same items as a Monk.

Starting Equipment

Some species may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

  • +2 dagger
  • +0 robe
  • +0 cloak
  • 9 poisoned darts
  • 3 curare darts

Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' aptitudes.

  • Fighting: 2
  • Short Blades: 2
  • Throwing: 2
  • Dodging: 1
  • Stealth: 4

Choosing Brigand adds 3 to your starting Strength, 3 to your starting Intelligence and 6 to your starting Dexterity.

Strategy

Brigands are a good general starting background for stealthy types; the enchanted dagger handles early-game monsters fairly well, while the curare and poisoned darts are excellent for taking down tougher targets.

Don't underestimate the power of curare. Curare deals a fair amount of damage on impact, then poisons and slows the enemy. Almost all early-game threats up to Lair will be greatly weakened by these darts. Of course, this assumes that you hit the dart. A few points into Throwing skill will increase your accuracy.

Since you start with 3 curare darts, and there's a 1 in 6 chance that they mulch (break) after fired, you'll have 18 shots on average. You can kite enemies in order to conserve them. Throw the curare dart, then back away and throw regular poisoned darts afterward, slowly whittling their HP down.

History

  • In 0.29, most backgrounds were buffed; Brigands gained an extra poison and curare dart.
  • Prior to 0.26, Brigands were called Assassins.
  • Prior to 0.24, Assassins began with a blowgun and their respective needles of poison and curare.
  • Prior to 0.15, the starting dagger had an enchantment of +2, +2.
  • Prior to 0.14, Assassins began with potions of poison identified, and had 50 gold.
Backgrounds
Warriors Fighter • Gladiator • Monk • Hunter • Brigand
Zealots Berserker • Chaos Knight • Cinder Acolyte
Warrior-mages Warper • Hexslinger • Enchanter • Reaver
Mages Hedge Wizard • Conjurer • Summoner • Necromancer • Fire Elementalist • Ice Elementalist • Air Elementalist • Earth Elementalist • Alchemist
Adventurers Artificer • Shapeshifter • Wanderer • Delver

{{flavour|A Brigand is a shady character who is especially good at killing, using daggers or darts. They start with a dagger, a robe and cloak, poisoned darts, and a few deadly and rare curare darts.}}
'''Brigands''' are operatives who specialize in stealth and the killing of unsuspecting victims. They start with the tools to silently and quickly take down the living.

==Preferred Species==
[[Troll]], [[Demonspawn]], [[Spriggan]], [[Vine Stalker]], and [[Vampire]] are the recommended races if you pick a Brigand background.

==Racial restrictions==
[[Felid]]s are forbidden from becoming Brigands because they cannot throw darts. A Felid Brigand would start with the same items as a [[Monk]].

==Starting Equipment==
Some [[species]] may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.
*+2 [[dagger]]
*+0 [[robe]]
*+0 [[cloak]]
*9 [[poison]]ed [[dart]]s
*3 [[curare]] darts

==Starting Skills and Stats==
These are adjusted by your species' [[aptitude]]s.
*[[Fighting]]: 2
*[[Short Blades]]: 2
*[[Throwing]]: 2
*[[Dodging]]: 1
*[[Stealth]]: 4

Choosing Brigand adds 3 to your starting [[Strength]], 3 to your starting [[Intelligence]] and 6 to your starting [[Dexterity]].

==Strategy==
Brigands are a good general starting background for stealthy types; the enchanted dagger handles early-game monsters fairly well, while the curare and poisoned darts are excellent for taking down tougher targets.

Don't underestimate the power of [[curare]]. Curare deals a fair amount of damage on impact, then poisons and [[slow]]s the enemy. Almost all early-game threats up to [[Lair]] will be greatly weakened by these darts. Of course, this assumes that you ''hit'' the dart. A few points into [[Throwing]] skill will increase your accuracy.

Since you start with 3 curare darts, and there's a 1 in 6 chance that they [[mulch]] (break) after fired, you'll have 18 shots on average. You can [[kite]] enemies in order to conserve them. Throw the curare dart, then back away and throw regular poisoned darts afterward, slowly whittling their HP down.

==History==
*In [[0.29]], most backgrounds were buffed; Brigands gained an extra poison and curare [[dart]].
*Prior to [[0.26]], Brigands were called '''Assassins'''.
*Prior to [[0.24]], Assassins began with a [[blowgun]] and their respective [[needle]]s of poison and curare.
*Prior to [[0.15]], the starting dagger had an enchantment of +2, +2.
*Prior to [[0.14]], Assassins began with [[potions of poison]] identified, and had 50 [[gold]].
